Job Posting:165384 - Position: S25 Intern (Canada) - Test Engineering 165384 E2 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 03/26/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 03/05/2025 10:34 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 Address Line 2 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Zebra Technologies Mississauga, Ontario - Psion 2100 Meadowvale Blvd Mississauga L5N 7J9 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Job Description 2025 - Summer S25 Intern (Canada) - Test Engineering 165384 E2 Co-op Position Mississauga, ON Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List Job Title: 2025 (4-Month) Intern (Canada) - Test Engineering Job ID: 107699 Remote Work: Hybrid Overview: At Zebra, we are a community of innovators who come together to create new ways of working to make everyday life better. United by curiosity and care, we develop dynamic solutions that anticipate our customer's and partner's needs and solve their challenges. Being a part of Zebra Nation means being seen, heard, valued, and respected. Drawing from our diverse perspectives, we collaborate to deliver on our purpose. Here you are a part of a team pushing boundaries to redefine the work of tomorrow for organizations, their employees, and those they serve. You have opportunities to learn and lead at a forward-thinking company, defining your path to a fulfilling career while channeling your skills toward causes that you care about - locally and globally. We've only begun reimaging the future - for our people, our customers, and the world. Let's create tomorrow together The purpose of this internship is to prepare college students for entry into the business world by providing a thorough understanding of the various functions of the Zebra Technologies organization. The program is designed to provide you with a full experience so that you can fully envision a career with Zebra. You will be positioned for success with training, exposure to all parts of the business, social activities, a professional mentor relationship and development sessions to help you discover your own performance edge! Responsibilities: • After an initial on the job training shadowing senior members of the staff to learn the current state of the processes, the intern will be challenged to help develop API and Test tools for the both H/W and SW products developed by Zebra Technologies. This will include but not limited to: • API Development • Perfrom analysis using statistical means (mean, standard deviation, distributions) • Able to use Data bases for analytics, reporting Experience with NoSQL (MongoDB) • Be able to use some basic Linux Systems • Programing using Object-Oriented Tools. • Co develop fixtures, Automation and Machine Vision soutions to support Manufacturing • Develop planning, organizational and leadership skills • Increase technology knowledge and skills • Develop team-based work proficiencies Develop interpersonal skills to connect with day-to-day business contacts through follow up activities • THIS IS A HYBRID INTERNSHIP. THIS INTERN MUST BE ABLE TO WORK ONSITE AT ZEBRA'S MISSISSAUGA, ONTARIO OFFICE AT LEAST 3 DAYS/WEEK. TARGET START DATE - MAY/JUNE 2025 Job Requirements Qualifications: Minimum Qualifications: • Current enrollment in an undergraduate/graduate degree program in Electrical Engineering or similar • Must have an anticipated graduation date before August 2026 • Knowledge of Python and Linux • Must be authorized to work in the Canada without requiring sponsorship now or in the future • Preferred Qualifications: • Proficient in Microsoft Office (including Excel, Word, & PowerPoint) • Exposure to API Development • Intellectual curiosity with a strong desire to learn and grow • Proven leadership and excellence in professional, academic, and/or extracurricular experiences • Ability to collaborate as part of a team Effective verbal and written communication skills • N/A Citizenship Requirement APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Optional Address Cover Letter to Hiring Manager Special Application Instructions Please apply via the link here: https://careers.zebra.com/careers/job?pid=343623423601&domain=zebra.com Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
